description: As wildfires ripped across Maui last August, a broad communications breakdown left authorities in the dark and residents without emergency alerts, according to a report released Wednesday.
title: A new report on the Maui wildfires cites communications breakdowns

description: The U.S. Supreme Court has made it easier for workers to bring employment discrimination suits over job transfers. The decision was unanimous, but the reasoning was not.
title: The Supreme Court opens the door to more discrimination claims involving job transfers

description: The Senate rejected the two articles that accuse Mayorkas of refusing to enforce immigration laws. The House voted to impeach him in February.
title: Senate kills articles of impeachment against Homeland Security Secretary Mayorkas

description: Sheriff Ed Lester said the animal was apparently "spooked by a vehicle" and briefly escaped before being recaptured by handlers. Videos of the unexpected sight were shared widely on social media.
title: Watch: A circus elephant runs loose in a Montana town before being recaptured

description: Ultra-Orthodox Israelis have long been exempt from compulsory military service. But the October 7th attack by Hamas and Israel's subsequent military response have brought forward calls for change. The government's decision on whether to end the exemption has major political consequences.
title: The Debate in Israel Over Who Should Be Required Serve in the Military

description: Divisions within the House Republican conference could threaten both the future of the package and Mike Johnson's speakership.
title: Speaker Johnson is moving forward with foreign aid bills despite threat to oust him

description: The Toronto Raptors player has been banned for life from the NBA after a probe found he disclosed confidential information to sports bettors and bet on games, even betting on the Raptors to lose.
title: NBA bans Jontay Porter after gambling probe shows he shared information, bet on games

description: The automaker is recalling Bronco Sport and Maverick vehicles due to a battery detection issue that can result in loss of drive power, increasing crash risks.
title: Ford recalls 456,000 Broncos, Mavericks that may lose power, raising crash risks

description: The Senate is still negotiating what the scope of the homeland security secretary's trial will be and whether to allow debate in the Democratic-controlled chamber.
title: Senators to be sworn in as jurors in Mayorkas impeachment trial

description: As a shortage of growth hormone used to treat rare diseases in children drags on, families and doctors are struggling with insurers' requirements to get prescriptions filled.
title: Persistent shortage of growth hormone frustrates parents and clinicians

description: Salman Rushdie is a storyteller. So when you ask him to describe the day, in 2022, when he was attacked and nearly killed by a young man with a knife, Rushdie paints a vivid picture.
title: Watch: Salman Rushdie on the moment he was attacked on stage, and why he felt lonely

description: The Senate kicks off the impeachment trial of the Homeland Security secretary. Coral reefs are undergoing a mass bleaching event that could soon be the worst on record.
title: Senate mulls next steps in Mayorkas impeachment; ocean heat is mass bleaching coral

description: We asked folks whose job it is to make the world a better place: How do you find the inner strength to keep plugging away in tough times? And what advice do you have for fledgling activists?
title: How do you keep calm and carry on in a world full of crises?

description: Some states make it much easier to get on the ballot as a minor-party presidential candidate, compared with running as an independent. That's why RFK Jr. and Cornel West have made their own parties.
title: Some independent candidates start their own political parties to ease ballot access

description: London Mayor Sadiq Khan talks to NPR about being a Muslim politician in Britain — and his fears around a second possible Donald Trump presidency.
title: Why London's Muslim mayor needs the same security as the king

description: Children and teens deal with the threat of gun violence on a daily basis in southeastern Pennsylvania. So community members and organizations are banding together to try to solve the dire problem.
title: As gun violence looms over Pennsylvania youth, local organizations offer safe spaces

description: The testimony from Columbia's president comes several months after lawmakers grilled the presidents of Harvard, MIT and the University of Pennsylvania.
title: Columbia University president is set to testify about antisemitism on campus

description: Most Medicare enrollees have two or more chronic conditions, making them eligible for a program that rewards physicians for doing more to manage their care. But not many doctors have joined.
title: Medicare's push to improve chronic care attracts businesses, but not many doctors

description: Climate change is heating oceans faster than the world's coral reefs can handle. So scientists are breeding corals that can withstand hotter temperatures – but only to a point.
title: Coral reefs can't keep up with climate change. So scientists are speeding up evolution

description: U.S. Olympic and Paralympic Committee officials and Team USA contenders met in New York City this week to discuss how they're preparing ahead of the Summer Games in Paris.
title: With 100 days before the Paris Olympics, Team USA hopefuls meet the press

description: People who fish in Florida and in federal waters are required to have special gear on board to help ensure groupers, snappers and other reef fish survive when they're returned to the water.
title: After catch and release, here's how to make sure reef fish survive

description: The White House says China uses subsidies and government programs to undercut U.S. steel. President Biden wants to triple tariffs on the imports and take other new steps to curb imports.
title: Biden wants to hike tariffs on imports of Chinese steel and aluminum

description: Volkswagen workers in Chattanooga, Tenn., are voting this week on whether to join the United Auto Workers union. Two previous attempts to unionize the plant failed. Ballots will be counted on Friday.
title: Why this vote at a Tennessee Volkswagen plant is historic for the South

description: Venezuela's president ordered the closure of his country's embassy in Ecuador in solidarity with Mexico in its protest over a raid by Ecuadorian authorities on the Mexican embassy in Quito.
title: Venezuela orders the closure of its embassy in Ecuador

description: The Panama Canal has been dubbed the greatest engineering feat in human history. It's also (perhaps less favorably) been called the greatest liberty mankind has ever taken with Mother Nature. But due to climate change, the Canal is drying up and fewer than half of the ships that used to pass through are now able to do so. So how did we get here? Today on the show, we're talking to Cristina Henriquez, the author of a new novel that explores the making of the Canal. It took 50,000 people from 90 different countries to carve the land in two — and the consequences of that extraordinary, nature-defying act are still echoing through our present.
title: The Rise and Fall of the Panama Canal

description: By the end of Tuesday, more than 5.59 inches of rain had soaked Dubai over 24 hours. An average year sees 3.73 inches at Dubai International Airport, which partially flooded and halted arrivals.
title: Storm dumps heaviest rain ever recorded in the United Arab Emirates

description: Graham gained national prominence as chairman of the Senate Intelligence Committee in the aftermath of the 2001 terrorist attacks and as an early critic of the Iraq war.
title: Bob Graham, former U.S. senator and Florida governor, has died at 87

description: The settlement between Smartmatic and One America News Network is the latest development in a larger legal pushback by voting equipment companies targeted by fraud claims related to the 2020 election.
title: Voting technology company settles lawsuit against OAN over 2020 election claims
